question: Which of the following features of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) makes it a living entity?
option4: Move from one cell to another
explanation: The human immunodeficiency virus is a type of virus called a retrovirus. Like all viruses, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) reproduces (replicates) using the genetic machinery of the cell it infects. With the help of an enzyme called integrase (also produced by HIV), the viral DNA becomes integrated with the cell\'s DNA.
